byline.contributor: Yamiche Alcindor contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton campaigns intensely ahead of primary in Kentucky, where white working-class voters are crucial to her success; Bernie Sanders's insistence on remaining in race, despite his shrinking odds of winning nomination, has prevented Clinton from focusing exclusively on general election.
lead_paragraph: With two Democratic primaries on Tuesday, Mrs. Clinton was hoping for a victory in Kentucky, but Bernie Sanders was expected to win easily in Oregon.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton, in Kentucky, Fights to Avert a 2-Loss Tuesday
headline.print_headline: Clinton Tries to Fend Off Sanders in Kentucky Even as She Turns to Trump

snippet: With two Democratic primaries on Tuesday, Mrs. Clinton was hoping for a victory in Kentucky, but Bernie Sanders was expected to win easily in Oregon.
